text:
The ring where Byleth sleeps. 
A mercenary who became a teacher.

The ring where Celica sleeps. 
The princess of a vibrant country, 
as well as a warrior priestess.

The ring where Eirika sleeps. 
A compassionate princess who takes 
up her sword for the sake of peace.

The ring where Ike sleeps. 
A famous mercenary leader with 
unparalleled skill in battle.

The ring where Corrin sleeps. 
A royal with an iron will and the 
blood of the First Dragons.

The ring where Leif sleeps. 
A brave prince in whose veins runs 
the blood of two crusaders.

The ring where Lyn sleeps. 
A virtuoso swordswoman from a 
nomadic tribe that lived in nature.

The ring where Lucina sleeps. 
A royal heir who knows anything can 
change and will not yield to despair.

The ring where Marth sleeps. 
A hero among heroes, brimming 
with nobility and charisma.

The ring where Micaiah sleeps. 
Bearer of strange healing powers 
as well as visions of the future.

The ring where Roy sleeps. 
A nobleman who excels as a general, 
brave and intelligent.

The ring where Sigurd sleeps. 
A noble knight with a mighty 
lineage.
Ring of the Instructor
Ring of the Caring Princess
's Ring
Ring of the Azure Twins
's Bond Rings
Ring of the Radiant Hero
Ring of the Crux of Fate
Ring of the Sage Lord
Ring of the Lady of the Plains
Ring of the Princess Exalt
Ring of the Connector
Ring of the Hero-King
Ring of the Dawn Maiden
Ring of the Young Lion
Ring of the Holy Knight
Special Bond Rings
World of the Instructor
World of the Caring Princess
World of the Azure Twins
World of the Radiant Hero
World of the Crux of Fate
World of the Sage Lord
World of the Lady of the Plains
World of the Princess Exalt
World of the Connector
World of the Hero-King
World of the Dawn Maiden
World of the Young Lion
World of the Holy Knight
Countless Worlds
Alfonse
Alm
Amelia
Anna
Azura
Arden
Asbel
Azelle
Inigo
Bernadetta
Black Knight

He lived in Fódlan as a mercenary 
until he became a professor.

Taking up the Sword of the Creator, 
he led his students into battle.
Caineghis
Camilla
Cecilia

Sole surviving Zofian royal in 
Valentia, a land in another world.

Traveled to investigate odd incidents 
and fought the god Duma with Alm.
Seliph
Shinon
Chrom
Claude
Conrad
Quan
Delthea
Deirdre
Dieck
Dimitri
Dorcas
Edelgard
Faye

The princess of Renais in the land of 
Magvel, beyond Elyos.

With her twin brother, Ephraim, she 
fought the Demon King Fomortiis.
Ilyana
Elise
Eliwood
Elincia
Ethlyn
Fae
Felix
Ferdinand
Erinys
Finn
Fir
Flayn
Florina
Gaius
Gatrie
Genny
Greil

Ring that grants the power of a hero 
linked to Emblem to those 
who wear it.

Ring that grants the power of a 
unique hero to those who wear it.

Prince of Askr, a land in another 
world.

A kind, earnest young member of the 
Order of Heroes that protects Askr.

He is dedicated to overcoming any 
challenge that obstructs victory.
Appears in Heroes.

Hero from beyond Elyos and the 
savior of the land of Valentia.

The brand on his left hand proved 
that he was chosen by prophecy.

He worked with Celica in her final 
battle against the wicked god Duma.
Appears in Shadows of Valentia.

Hero from beyond Elyos and trainee 
soldier from the Grado Empire.

While naive, she is also cheerful, 
honest, and incredibly dedicated.

She fought Eirika and Ephraim, 
believing that they were villains.
Appears in The Sacred Stones.

Warrior of Askr, a land in another 
world.

A skilled fighter and commander of 
the Order of Heroes protecting Askr.

Typically caring and reliable, she has 
been known to lose her composure a 
little when it comes to money matters.
Appears in Heroes.

Hero from beyond Elyos who was 
kidnapped and raised in Hoshido.

She has a mysterious, fragile aura 
and rarely reveals her emotions.

She is a songstress who uses both 
her dancing and lance as weapons.

Appears in Birthright, Conquest, 
and others.

Hero from beyond Elyos who served 
under Sigurd as an armored knight.

Member of the Grünritter order of 
the Knights of Chalphy.

Known by allies as strong and tough, 
but unfortunately slow.

Appears in Genealogy of the 
Holy War.

Hero from beyond Elyos skilled in 
the use of wind magic.

He learned much while studying 
under Ced, leader of the Magi.

He and Leif met in their youth and 
vowed to take back Thracia.
Appears in Thracia 776.

Son of the Duke of Velthomer on 
Jugdral, a continent in another world.

A gentle fire mage descended from 
the crusader and mage fighter Fjalar.

He fought to rescue his love, Edain, 
from her kidnapping.

Appears in Genealogy of the 
Holy War.

Hero from beyond Elyos and 
Olivia's son.

An amiable young man who was one 
of the children from the future.

He's an incorrigible flirt who is 
shyer than he lets on.
Appears in Awakening.

Hero from beyond Elyos and the 
only daughter of House Varley.

A Black Eagle student who is 
extremely afraid of strangers.

A reclusive young woman, she hides 
in her room when not in class.
Appears in Three Houses.

Hero from beyond Elyos who was 
Daein's most powerful general.

Black-armored and peerlessly strong 
member of the elite "Four Riders."

After killing Greil, he clashed with 
Greil's son, Ike, in deadly skirmishes.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

King of Gallia on Tellius, a continent 
in another world.

A laguz lion shape-shifter who led a 
tribe who could transform into beasts.

He dedicated all his strength to 
peace between laguz and humans.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

The eldest princess of Nohr, a land 
in another world.

A beautiful, bewitching woman who 
rides a wyvern into battle.

She likes girls who are strong yet 
cute and dotes endlessly on Corrin.

Appears in Birthright, Conquest, 
and others.

Hero from beyond Elyos who was an 
Etrurian general.

One of the three generals of her 
nation, she commanded their mages.

A wise, astute woman and mentor 
who taught Roy how to fight.
Appears in The Binding Blade.

Hero from beyond Elyos known as 
the "Scion of Light."

Son of Sigurd and Deirdre and 
descendant of the crusader Baldr.

Became the savior of Jugdral by 
leading an army against Grannvale.

Appears in Genealogy of the Holy 
War and Thracia 776.

Hero from beyond Elyos and an 
archer in the Greil Mercenaries.

An expert marksman who does not 
miss his target.

He can be cynical, but it's just a 
facade for how much he cares.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Prince of the Halidom of Ylisse, a 
land in another world.

A descendant of the Hero-King, he 
led the Shepherds to protect Ylisse.

With Robin and his future daughter, 
he battled the Fell Dragon Grima.
Appears in Awakening.

Heir to House Riegan of the Leicester 
Alliance, found in another world.

Leader of the Golden Deer House at 
Garreg Mach Monastery.

Though laid-back and friendly, he is 
also a schemer to the core.
Appears in Three Houses.

Hero from beyond Elyos and an 
enigmatic masked knight.

He appeared whenever Celica was 
in danger and saved her many times.

The white mask hiding his face 
shrouds him in mystery.
Appears in Shadows of Valentia.

Prince of Leonster on Jugdral, a 
continent in another world.

A descendant of crusader Njörun, 
he inherited the holy lance Gáe Bolg.

Sigurd's friend since their academy 
days, he values friendship and justice.

Appears in Genealogy of the 
Holy War.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a mage 
with a cheery personality.

Alm freed her from an enemy's 
control and they became allies.

She hated the village of her birth and 
dreamed of romance in the big city.
Appears in Shadows of Valentia.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a 
priestess of the Spirit Forest.

Forbidden from interaction, she still 
met Sigurd and became his wife.

They lived happily with their son 
Seliph until a dark cult intervened.

Appears in Genealogy of the 
Holy War.

Hero from beyond Elyos who was a 
mercenary hired by House Pherae.

He cultivated the unwavering trust of 
his comrades as a leader.

Once a gladiator, he made quite a 
name for himself in the arena.
Appears in The Binding Blade.

Crown prince of the Holy Kingdom of 
Faerghus, a land in another world.

Leader of the Blue Lion House at 
Garreg Mach Monastery.

He is courteous and sincere, but he 
hides darkness deep in his heart.
Appears in Three Houses.

Hero from beyond Elyos and warrior 
from a remote village.

He hired himself out to bandits to 
pay for his wife's medical treatment.

Reserved and devoted to his family, 
he joined Lyn when she rescued him.
Appears in The Blazing Blade.

Imperial princess of the Adrestian 
Empire, a land in another world.

Leader of the Black Eagle House at 
the Garreg Mach Monastery.

She is a noble woman who is 
determined to reform the world.
Appears in Three Houses.

Hero from beyond Elyos who was 
head over heels in love with Alm.

Alm's childhood friend from Ram 
Village.

She liked Alm since childhood and 
wished to live with him one day.
Appears in Shadows of Valentia.

Hero from beyond Elyos who wields 
lightning magic.

Joined Ike when she found herself 
in a battle against her will.

She looks fragile, but she's a big 
eater and always seems hungry.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Princess of Nohr, a country in 
another world.

The youngest of the Nohrian royals. 
She is innocent and cheerful.

She loves all her siblings and very 
much admires Corrin.

Appears in Birthright, Conquest, 
and others.

A noble of House Pherae in Elibe, a 
continent in another world.

Sincere and straightforward, he 
journeyed to find his missing father.

He was duped by Nergal, but in the 
end took him on with his friends.

Appears in The Binding Blade and 
The Blazing Blade.

Queen of Crimea on Tellius, a 
continent in another world.

Pure of heart, she loved her country 
and was adored by her people.

She deplored conflict, going so far 
as to disarm herself in battle.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Daughter of the Duke of Chalphy on 
Jugdral, a continent in another world.

Lord Sigurd's dependable and caring 
younger sister.

Married Quan, her brother's friend, 
with whom she had Altena and Leif.

Appears in Genealogy of the 
Holy War.

Hero from beyond Elyos who was 
the last surviving Divine Dragon.

A manakete, she lived in a hidden 
village in the Nabata Desert.

Despite her naive appearance, she is 
several centuries old.

Appears in The Binding Blade and 
The Blazing Blade.

Hero from beyond Elyos and heir to 
House Fraldarius.

A Blue Lion student who is Dimitri's 
childhood friend.

He cares only about finding a worthy 
adversary for his sword skills.
Appears in Three Houses.

Hero from beyond Elyos and heir to 
House Aegir.

A Black Eagle student who takes 
great pride in his noble status.

Edelgard's role as imperial princess 
brings out his competitive streak.
Appears in Three Houses.

Hero from beyond Elyos and pegasus 
knight who served Silesse.

One of the Four Heavenly Knights, 
she searched for Prince Lewyn.

Highly capable, but also overly 
serious and somewhat gullible.

Appears in Genealogy of the 
Holy War.

Hero from beyond Elyos who served 
Leif as a knight.

Served two generations of princes as 
a loyal retainer of Leonster.

He escaped with Leif when Leonster 
Castle fell and raised him afterward.

Appears in Genealogy of the Holy 
War and Thracia 776.

Hero from beyond Elyos who lives 
for the sword.

Honed her fighting skills to emulate 
her mother, the "Princess of Swords."

She's a bit gullible and got tricked 
by pirates into working for them.
Appears in The Binding Blade.

Hero from beyond Elyos and 
Seteth's younger sister.

She lives at Garreg Mach Monastery 
under her brother's protection.

She is sheltered and very interested 
in all sorts of things in town.
Appears in Three Houses.

Hero from beyond Elyos who trained 
to be a pegasus knight of Ilia.

A quiet, compassionate young 
woman and animal lover.

Though shy and easily scared, she 
supported Lyn on her journey.
Appears in The Blazing Blade.

Hero from beyond Elyos and thief 
from the Halidom of Ylisse.

Composed and clever, he would take 
on any job for the right price.

He loves sweets and conceals them 
all over his person.
Appears in Awakening.

Hero from beyond Elyos and member 
of the Greil Mercenaries.

An amiable goof and sworn brother 
to Shinon, an older mercenary.

He's a fool for women but never gets 
discouraged in the face of rejection.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Hero from beyond Elyos and an 
easygoing cleric.

She served at the priory on Novis 
Island and traveled with Celica.

She is carefree and enjoys reading 
or writing stories at home.
Appears in Shadows of Valentia.

Hero from beyond Elyos who 
founded the Greil Mercenaries.

A well-trusted and top-notch 
mercenary with superb skill in battle.

He is Ike and Mist's father, and he 
sees all of the mercenaries as family.
Appears in Path of Radiance.

The prince of Frelia on Magvel, a 
continent in another world.

He is both proud and wise. Known 
as an expert archer.

He can come off as aloof, but under 
that exterior, he is a good person.
Appears in The Sacred Stones.

A noble of Ostia in the Lycia region 
of Elibe, a land in another world.

A strong, exuberant young man who 
taught himself how to wield an axe.

As children, he and Eliwood swore 
an undying oath of friendship.

Appears in The Binding Blade and 
The Blazing Blade.

The eldest princess of Hoshido, a 
country in another world.

She charges fearlessly into battle 
astride a pegasus.

She became a sky knight in hopes of 
recovering Corrin from Nohr.

Appears in Birthright, Conquest, 
and others.

Hero from beyond Elyos and the only 
daughter of House Galatea.

A serious and level-headed Blue Lion 
student.

She admires noble knights and 
dreams of becoming one.
Appears in Three Houses.

Princess of Isaach on Jugdral, a 
continent in another world.

A skilled swordswoman who became 
Sigurd's ally and fought by his side.

Descendant of the crusader Od and 
master of the special skill Astra.

Appears in Genealogy of the 
Holy War.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a Black 
Fang assassin.

Known as the "Angel of Death," he is 
one of the elite Four Fangs.

Spending time with Nino drew him 
from his emotionless shell.
Appears in The Blazing Blade.

Hero from beyond Elyos who is an 
easygoing swordsman.

He loves gambling and makes any 
important decisions with a coin flip.

He betrayed the Grado Empire based 
on a flipped coin.
Appears in The Sacred Stones.

Hero from beyond Elyos who served 
Corrin as a butler.

Quick-witted and versatile, he has a 
talent for both care and combat.

He swore absolute loyalty to Corrin 
and treats all others with disdain.

Appears in Birthright, Conquest, 
and others.

Hero from beyond Elyos and young 
tactician-in-training.

Went to serve Marth at Altea Castle 
and joined the 7th Platoon with Kris.

She is calm and cares for her friends, 
but harbors a terrible secret inside.

Appears in New Mystery of 
the Emblem.

Hero from beyond Elyos and royal 
guard who served under Marth.

Hailed from the kingdom of Altea and 
became a knight of the 7th Platoon.

Behind-the-scenes hero who guarded 
Marth in battles across the land.

Appears in New Mystery of 
the Emblem.

Hero from beyond Elyos who is a 
righteous defender of others.

She traveled the length of Magvel 
defeating any monsters she found.

As princess of Rausten, she fought 
alongside her two attendants.
Appears in The Sacred Stones.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a beast 
warrior from Gallia.

An easygoing laguz shape-shifter 
who can become a massive cat.

Though he appears laid-back, he's 
utterly fearless in combat.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Princess of Serenes on Tellius, a 
continent in another world.

Miraculously escaped unharmed 
when her homeland was destroyed.

She is pure of heart and can heal her 
allies' fatigue with her Galdrar.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

A prince of Nohr, a country in 
another world.

He is an elite dark mage who uses 
the divine tome Brynhildr.

He is a natural-born prodigy, but he 
can also be a bit absentminded.

Appears in Birthright, Conquest, 
and others.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a beast 
warrior from Gallia.

A laguz shape-shifter who can 
transform into a massive cat.

She dislikes the beorc, but she will 
obey royal orders to work with them.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Prince of Silesse on Jugdral, a 
continent in another world.

Descendant of the crusader Ced, he 
inherited the holy wind tome Forseti.

Fought alongside Sigurd and, after 
his death, his son, Seliph, as well.

Appears in Genealogy of the Holy 
War and Thracia 776.

A noble of Ostia in the Lycia region 
of Elibe, a land in another world.

An extremely gifted mage and Roy's 
childhood friend.

As Hector's daughter, she combines 
innocent looks with a stout heart.

Appears in The Binding Blade and 
The Blazing Blade.

Duchess of Tarrah on Jugdral, a 
continent in another world.

A gentle and wise leader who 
succeeded her late father.

A descendant of Saint Heim, she 
joined Leif to oppose the Empire.
Appears in Thracia 776.

Princess of the Halidom of Ylisse, a 
land in another world.

A compassionate member of the 
Shepherds who treats all equally.

Her high energy makes her an 
inspiring presence in the Shepherds.
Appears in Awakening.

Hero from beyond Elyos who appears 
mature beyond his years.

The younger of twin orphans, adept 
at using Dark magic.

He has a sharp tongue, but he is 
extremely devoted to his family.
Appears in The Binding Blade.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a young 
boy with a steadfast heart.

The older of twin orphans, adept 
at using Anima magic.

He is tender-hearted but won't balk 
at protecting the ones he loves.
Appears in The Binding Blade.

Hero from beyond Elyos who fought 
to free Zofia as a Deliverance soldier.

This young man with a gentle air led 
Alm to join the Deliverance forces.

Born into nobility, but treats all with 
respect, regardless of their lineage.
Appears in Shadows of Valentia.

Hero from beyond Elyos who has a 
prodigious talent for magic.

A confident mage who often asserts 
her superiority.

Her eccentric mannerisms make it 
difficult to tell when she is joking.
Appears in The Sacred Stones.

Hero from beyond Elyos and the 
eldest daughter of House Ordelia.

A diligent Golden Deer student 
possessing great talent with magic.

She loves sweets, but hates ghosts 
and being treated like a child.
Appears in Three Houses.

Hero from beyond Elyos with a 
cheerful and positive disposition.

Mage from Novis who journeyed 
with Celica to the Temple of Mila.

Cared about and supported Celica 
both as a servant and as a friend.
Appears in Shadows of Valentia.

Child of Robin, hero from 
beyond Elyos.

A time traveler who aspires to be 
a great tactician like Robin.

Suffers from amnesia but remains 
energetic, cheerful, and driven.
Appears in Awakening.

Hero from beyond Elyos and sword 
fighter of the Fiana Freeblades.

The adopted daughter of Eyvel, head 
of the Fiana Freeblades.

Descendant of the crusader Od and 
master of the skills Luna and Astra.
Appears in Thracia 776.

Hero from beyond Elyos and member 
of Gerik's Mercenaries.

A remarkable swordswoman known, 
and feared, as the Crimson Flash.

She has a taciturn demeanor and 
trusts Commander Gerik completely.
Appears in The Sacred Stones.

Hero from beyond Elyos and magical 
prodigy known as the "Wind Mage."

Studied in Khadein and inherited 
the wind magic tome Excalibur.

A member of Altean nobility and a 
childhood friend of Prince Marth.

Appears in Shadow Dragon & the 
Blade of Light and others.

The eldest prince of Nohr, a country 
in another world.

The crown prince. He inherited the 
divine sword Siegfried.

He is a chivalrous knight who can be 
strict as easily as he can be kind.

Appears in Birthright, Conquest, 
and others.

Hero from beyond Elyos who served 
House Ostia as a spy.

Forms connections easily with his 
cheerful and open demeanor.

Though he seems scatterbrained, he 
always sees his missions through.
Appears in The Blazing Blade.

Princess of Macedon on Archanea, a 
continent in another world.

A proud and gallant woman also 
known as the "Red Dragoon."

To reform her homeland, she fought 
against them as a traitor.

Appears in Shadow Dragon & the 
Blade of Light and others.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a 
staff wielder in the Greil Mercenaries.

She is Ike's pure-hearted and 
compassionate younger sister.

She always watches to see what she 
can do for the others of the group.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Hero from beyond Elyos known as 
the "Scarlet Sword."

Appeared as a bodyguard for bandits, 
fighting with deadly blade in hand.

He claims that he would never "turn 
his blade on a woman."

Appears in Shadow Dragon & the 
Blade of Light and others.

King of Kilvas on Tellius, a continent 
in another world.

A laguz shape-shifter, he led a tribe 
that could transform into ravens.

Cunning and calculating, he puts his 
nation before all else.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Hero from beyond Elyos and the 
daughter of the Princess Lachesis.

She was raised by Finn, a knight of 
Leonster, alongside Prince Leif.

She fought to liberate Thracia with 
her mother's noble spirit.

Appears in Genealogy of the Holy 
War and Thracia 776.

Hero from beyond Elyos and soldier 
of Crimea.

To save her home, she joined the 
war as a volunteer soldier.

She is a woman of few words but a 
strong love for her country.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Queen of Hatari on Tellius, a 
continent in another world.

A laguz who could petrify foes with 
an evil eye and turn into a huge wolf.

Encountered Prince Rafiel collapsed 
in the desert and fell in love with him.
Appears in Radiant Dawn.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a 
traveling dancer.

Befriended Eliwood and Lyn when 
they saved her from bandits.

A fragile girl whose hidden secret 
could shake the world.
Appears in The Blazing Blade.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a 
kind-hearted mage-in-training.

Neglected adopted daughter of the 
head of the Black Fang assassins.

She thinks of the members of her 
organization as if they were family.
Appears in The Blazing Blade.

Hero from beyond Elyos and an 
innocent young dragon.

A manakete in human form. She is 
far older than she appears.

She loves having fun with others, 
and is an inveterate late sleeper.
Appears in Awakening.

Hero from beyond Elyos who led a 
band of mercenaries in Talys.

Extremely capable battlefield veteran 
who used to be a gladiator.

Has held Caeda in high esteem since 
she saved him in his gladiator days.

Appears in Shadow Dragon & the 
Blade of Light and others.

Hero from beyond Elyos and mage 
knight with a serious demeanor.

Reinhardt's younger sister, a soldier 
serving the Friege house.

She is principled and left the army 
upon learning of its cruel practices.
Appears in Thracia 776.

Hero from beyond Elyos who fought 
in the Fiana Freeblades with his axe.

Hot-headed and proud, he is skilled 
with the throwing axe Vouge.

Though brash, he's also a cheerful 
and inspiring presence in the army.
Appears in Thracia 776.

Hero from beyond Elyos and 
Lissa's son.

A Brand-bearer of Exalted blood 
who came from the future.

He's a pompous, excitable show-off 
who cares most about looking cool.
Appears in Awakening.

Princess of Nordion on Jugdral, a 
continent in another world.

The beautiful and noble younger 
sister of King Eldigan the Lionheart.

Criticized many of her suitors for not 
measuring up to her brother.

Appears in Genealogy of the 
Holy War.

Hero from beyond Elyos and the son 
of a Leicester Alliance merchant.

A Golden Deer student with a big 
appetite and a burly physique.

What he lacks in book learning he 
makes up for in devotion to training.
Appears in Three Houses.

Hero from beyond Elyos and 
daughter of a Pheraen village leader.

She allied herself with Eliwood to 
repay him for saving her village.

A cheerful and gentle archer who 
mastered the bow by hunting.
Appears in The Blazing Blade.

Hero from beyond Elyos with the gift 
of powerful magic.

The strong-willed daughter of 
Pontifex Miloah from Archanea.

Her father passed down Aura magic 
to her for her fight against Gharnef.

Appears in Shadow Dragon & the 
Blade of Light and others.

Hero from beyond Elyos who 
belonged to a group of assassins.

Known for his suspicious mask and 
odd laugh during battle.

Worked with his many identical 
"brothers" to assassinate targets.

Appears in New Mystery of 
the Emblem.

Hero from beyond Elyos and the son 
of the warrior Garcia.

A fledgling warrior of Renais filled 
with youthful excitement and vigor.

He devoted himself to training so 
that he could be more like his father.
Appears in The Sacred Stones.

Hero from beyond Elyos who is a 
solitary swordsman of few words.

When his home was destroyed by 
Bern's forces, he sought revenge.

Switched allegiance to fight with Roy 
when he learned Roy opposed Bern.
Appears in The Binding Blade.

The eldest prince of Hoshido, a 
country in another world.

The crown prince. He inherited the 
divine sword Raijinto.

He is a samurai with the indomitable 
will to face any hardship.

Appears in Birthright, Conquest, 
and others.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a 
strong, capable mercenary.

He was hired by Celica to escort her 
across a sea frequented by pirates.

A long-time adviser and guardian of 
Celica. A rogue with a good heart.
Appears in Shadows of Valentia.

Princess of Hoshido, a country in 
another world.

Youngest of the Hoshidan royals. 
She is elegant and tenderhearted.

She is polite but shy and easily 
flustered.

Appears in Birthright, Conquest, 
and others.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a dark 
mage from Plegia.

Wicked and deeply jealous, she was 
known for her curses.

She became very attached to Robin, 
whom she followed like a shadow.
Appears in Awakening.

Empress of Begnion on Tellius, a 
continent in another world.

The 37th empress and apostle was 
said to hear the voice of the goddess.

She is young, but strong-willed and 
virtuous in her leadership.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Hero from beyond Elyos and cleric 
with a mysterious power.

She became Leif's ally when she 
heard him call out for help.

Despised her grandfather, Manfroy, 
the great priest of the Loptr Church.
Appears in Thracia 776.

Princess of Talys on Archanea, a 
continent in another world.

Pegasus knight with a cheerful 
nature and engaging natural charm.

Met Marth after he fled his home. 
They eventually became engaged.

Appears in Shadow Dragon & the 
Blade of Light and others.

Hero from beyond Elyos who joined 
the Greil Mercenaries as a mage.

A trusted adviser due to his sound 
judgment, he excels at finding intel.

He is uncomfortable around most 
others, but he is very close to Ike.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Hero from beyond Elyos and 
Cordelia's daughter.

One of the children from the future 
known for her strong will and snark.

She's thoroughly devious and a 
dedicated wastrel.
Appears in Awakening.

Hero from beyond Elyos who served 
Ostia as a cleric.

She shrewdly joined Lyn in order to 
gain a powerful ally.

She is very likable despite her habit 
of pursuing her own agenda.
Appears in The Blazing Blade.

Hero from beyond Elyos who served 
the Renais royal family as a knight.

A young general known by many as 
the Silver Knight.

He protected and aided Eirika during 
an invasion by the Grado Empire.
Appears in The Sacred Stones.

Prince of Silesse on Jugdral, a 
continent in another world.

The son of Lewyn, he inherited the 
holy wind magic tome Forseti.

He formed the Magi, a resistance 
group. Known as "Hero on the Wind."

Appears in Genealogy of the Holy 
War and Thracia 776.

Princess of Askr, a land in another 
world.

A bright and energetic member of 
the Order of Heroes protecting Askr.

Bubbly and amiable, she hopes to 
befriend heroes from other worlds.
Appears in Heroes.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a 
wandering swordsman.

This black-clad master of the sword 
wields his blade with deadly skill.

Though cold, he is not heartless, and 
detests the waste of any life.
Appears in Thracia 776.

Hero from beyond Elyos and devout 
cleric serving the goddess Mila.

She was captured by thieves and 
saved by Alm, becoming his ally.

A pious soul hopeful that Mila's 
teachings will save all who suffer.
Appears in Shadows of Valentia.

Hero from beyond Elyos who is a 
shaman with a mystical air.

Her special powers include the 
ability to predict the future.

Guided Roy to a hidden village where 
people and dragons coexist.

Appears in The Binding Blade and 
The Blazing Blade.

Hero from beyond Elyos adopted by 
Micaiah as a younger brother.

A young freedom fighter with the 
Dawn Brigade resistance group.

Though unrelated to Micaiah, he 
loved her as his adopted sister.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

A prince of Hoshido, a country in 
another world.

An expert archer who wields the 
divine bow Fujin Yumi.

He despises Nohr and has complex 
feelings toward Corrin.

Appears in Birthright, Conquest, 
and others.

Hero from beyond Elyos and deputy 
commander of the Greil Mercenaries.

A lance-wielding combat veteran and 
former Crimean Royal Knight.

She was a den mother to Ike and the 
other members of the group.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Hero from beyond Elyos and pegasus 
knight of the Halidom of Ylisse.

A renowned beauty with exceptional 
talent who completes any task well.

Her unrequited feelings toward 
Chrom caused her to sigh frequently.
Appears in Awakening.

King of Phoenicis on Tellius, a 
continent in another world.

A laguz shape-shifter who led a tribe 
that could transform into hawks.

The Hawk King rallied his allies with 
his charisma and decisive action.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a 
Divine Dragon princess.

A manakete who took human form 
after sealing away her dragon power.

She was Marth's staunch ally after 
he saved her from Gharnef's control.

Appears in Shadow Dragon & the 
Blade of Light and others.

The princess of Frelia on Magvel, a 
continent in another world.

Boisterous despite her nobility, she 
is a lance-wielding pegasus knight.

She ran away from the castle to help 
Eirika, her close friend.
Appears in The Sacred Stones.

Hero from beyond Elyos and a proud 
warrior.

Fought to avenge the death of his 
family, who were killed by pirates.

An open-minded and helpful soul, 
well liked by all.
Appears in Shadows of Valentia.

Hero from beyond Elyos and member 
of the Greil Mercenaries.

A frank and lively young woman who 
doesn't sweat the details.

She's always seeking opponents to 
hone her sword skills in battle.

Appears in Path of Radiance and 
Radiant Dawn.

Hero from beyond Elyos who served 
Roy as an archer.

A cheerful boy, he worked diligently 
to justify his role as Roy's retainer.

His mother was Roy's nanny, making 
Roy his stepbrother of sorts.
Appears in The Binding Blade.

Hero from beyond Elyos who 
founded Gerik's Mercenaries.

A powerful and renowned veteran, 
he is known as the "Desert Tiger."

He is a compassionate man of honor 
who has earned the trust of his allies.
Appears in The Sacred Stones.
